title: why I quit league ?
body:
i write big reasons i quit playing lol (im on my friend account because i sold my account)
im not so good in english language grammer and i just know words 

#1 : I cant imagine my favorite champion get reworked
before 18, I played about 10 hours daily of league from 2016 to 2017 and in this times, i was just trying to learn champions, after all of that I finally learnt Master Yi, because Cowsep had stream about it and guides, and everyone said me u are in Bronze V so dont even think to a difficult champ to main, finally  I mastered Master Yi but in recent months when i saw people complaining about Yi true damage and this is being a big topic, im thinking that will he be next rework ? and can I play that much of time to master other champions ? for learning how to win Yi vs Rammus or Yi vs Jax or Yi vs Udyr or Yi vs Kha'Zix i put a lot of time , just thinking about this that yi can get reworked makes me uninterested to play game, specially after i saw aatrox changed from an Auto attack champion to an ability user , that just hurts. i never get it what riot means by not having counterplay

#2 : dropping honor made game so exhausting for me
during my playing time, i dropped to honor1, after months not only i was still honor1, but i saw all of my friends have many Emotes like 6-7 and they got all of them from chests, while i had just 4 emotes (2 of them about event and level of account !) and I had S but game didnt give me Chests and again i see my friends have super nice skins from chest while im  not getting chests (Keys were actual problem because i had enough chests, i was honor1 game didnt gave me Key), in addition to all, I wasnt able to play with my friends in Clash, tho clash crashed in EUW, but not being able to play with my friends was so frustrating for me even 2 of my friends didnt join clash to support me.

#3 : league is only game that ban you from game for TYPING and ban system isnt fair
I got banned permanently once this year after being so frustrated in games, not only this system isnt fair at all (if you play one game daily and you are toxic in games you will never face a penalty, if you play a lot and you are toxic in some games you will face a penalty, also riot dont give your teammate a penalty for banning your champ is champ selection, they dont ban people if they are feeding or staying in bush in game, they only ban you for Typing) after playing game for 2 years daily 10hours (and 4 other hours i was watching streams !) i had an account with 20 champ and 0 skins, all of my moments and masteries and champions and skins (and money!) were wasted, i cant actually say losing rank was sad for me because you can easily rank up back, but after playing for 2 years, my account was lower than a newbie player, i could accept all of this punishments if they was in everywhere, even in real life police dont kill you and get your life if you are angry and for example firing a car in middle of street, not even one other single game i played until now (Video Games like Dota2, CS1.6 ,Source, Zero and GO, Fortnite, PUBG ... or Web Games like Tank, Worms, Travian ... or even Android Games like Clash of Clans...) banned me for saying bad words or being "TOXIC" in game, they never waste all of what you tried for and your life, actually game was my life for 1-2 years, none of the games ban you from game or ban your account for that, they dont even take your pride, only punishment is getting muted in game 

**LoL punishments are like Genghis Khan Yasa(rules), Mongols kill you for something like breaking a glass, this is a joke in modern world until you are playing under Riot Rules, maybe call it Rasa !**

if you agree with my reasons +1 me or if you agree with one of two of them, say your comments about what you disagree.

Punishing toxic people in a video game by banning them (after giving them multiple warnings) is not at all equivalent to killing people because they have aids. The punishments league has in place for toxic behavior in game are perfectly appropriate. You have to actively be a negative presence in game to get banned, especially permanently. You not only have to type nasty things to your teammates in chat, but you have to do it repeatedly (and usually after multiple warnings).

I understand some people have trouble controlling themselves, are toxic for the laughs, or otherwise struggle to keep their hands off their keys but anyone who acts like that should 100% be ready for a ban. You know the rules, you know you have other ways to vent frustration (I say things vocally, out of chat, all the time)  and instead you decide to flame in game. I don't just think you guys deserve the bans you get, I'm happy you get banned. Especially when you make posts like this.

Happy trails buddy, hope you find something fun to do that doesn't involve you treating others like garbage.

I'd agree with the first part of this since I've just had my favorite champion deleted in a rework and my 2nd about to change also. But, how can people complain so much about the honor system? I've been toxic in games and afk'd out of rage before and never had a penalty. You have to consistently be a massive jerk to get any kind of punishment out of the system. You also get multiple escalating punishments as a warning. Sorry, but if you eat a ban in this system you most likely deserved it. 

As for Yi, he has already been reworked once and probably isn't even in the top 30 champions on Riot's radar to rework again. There are so many champions in the game that are just flat out garbage right now. You're safe there.

i used to think that too until Riot AI slapped me with a 15 game chat restriction (very low) over two very, very mild chat (one was me calling someone else out for being toxic and the other was me complaining that my team isn't following up on my engages. seriously. obviously my choice of words wasn't angelic but it really wasn't that bad)
and now I have to climb from Honor 1, which by testimony people say takes about 6 months. If they play 1 game every day that is 180 games. So for two rather mild games (mind you the people i called out for being toxic were literally calling me worthless, telling me to uninstall and disappear from the earth)
I am the one getting punished for almost 200 games. Not them. hahaha funny. You can check my post history for the chat log.

Sharing accounts totally does get punished. I know people it happened to.

But that aside, here:

1. Reworks happen when a character is unhealthy for the game and cannot be balanced effectively. Aatrox had problems involving how he was a stat-stick. Trades and Laning shouldn't be a stat-check, it should be skill based. Aatrox could just stat-check people in-lane before the rework.

2. Dropping honor sucks, and I do think it should be easier to regain honor. However, that disappointment of seeing friends with it while you don't have it is sort of the point. If you want to have the good stuff, you have to be good too.
If you're stuck in honor 1 for multiple months and you play with any frequency then you are likely doing things that are still getting reported and the system _does_ judge to be not okay. If you are validly reported for things you shouldn't be doing and it doesn't warrant a full-on punishment, you will still lose your honor progress towards unlocked / honor 2. Riot should be clearer about this, I think they've even said they wished it had better clarity, but for now this is how it works.

3. It's a game, designed for people to have fun. If you are behaving in a manner that directly ruins other peoples' fun then it goes against the design of the game. Riot is well within their rights to remove anybody who does this. You included. Typing or gameplay, it doesn't matter, because both can ruin peoples' fun.
Instead of moaning about how it's unfair that you were punished for typing, why don't you try to figure out what you did wrong and learn how to be better? Posting that you quit certainly won't garner any sympathy, not from players who have had to deal with people who behaved horribly in chat.
